title: The Case of the Banana in the Mailbox
summary: Someone mailed a banana. That’s illegal in 12 countries and also in the Mayor’s heart. Solve four clues (times tables, sharing, coins, and clocks) to find the fibber.

introLetter.subjectLine: EMERGENCY: A banana has entered the mailbox. It is smug.
bodyParagraphs: We found a banana inside Mailbox #7. Not in an envelope. Not in a bag. Just… banana.
Three suspects were spotted nearby: a coin-counting countess, a clock-obsessed squirrel, and a crate-stacking mole.
Please solve the clues before the banana starts charging rent.

postmark.stampSlogan: Goofington Postal Service: We Do Not Endorse Bananas.

suspects.name: Countess Coinella

alibi.claim: I paid 65¢ for a banana-scented candle using EXACT change. It was art.
alibi.note: Her money story should match the coin clue.

quips: I never panic. I merely… reorganize.

suspects.name: Clockwork Squirrel

alibi.claim: At exactly 9:05, I was polishing the town clock. At 9:50, I was still polishing. Time is circular!
alibi.note: If he can’t read the clocks correctly, his whole alibi wobbles.

quips: Tick tock is just a suggestion.
If you’re late, blame the sun.

suspects.name: Crate-Stacker Mole

alibi.claim: I stacked crates in perfect groups. Multiplication is my love language.
alibi.note: His multiplication should be solid. We’ll test it.

quips: Never trust a banana with confidence.

locations.name: Mailbox Row (Banana District)
locations.description: A row of mailboxes, each with a unique personality. Mailbox #7 is currently panicking.

locations.name: Coin Counter Corner
locations.description: A table covered in coins and little velvet bags. The coins look smug too.

locations.name: Clock Tower (No Banana Allowed)
locations.description: A giant clock face with fingerprints everywhere. Also one banana peel.

evidence.label: Banana Crate Invoice
evidence.description: An invoice for 3 crates with 4 bananas each. Someone wrote 'DO NOT MAIL' in glitter ink.

evidence.label: Split Sandwich Diagram
evidence.description: A diagram showing 24 sandwich slices shared equally. A mole has drawn a victory crown.

evidence.label: Coin Trail
evidence.description: A neat row of coins that totals exactly 65¢. The banana seems impressed.

evidence.label: Clock Smudge
evidence.description: A smudgy thumbprint on the 1. Someone misread 9:05 as 9:50. Oops.

puzzles.title: Crate Stack Combo (×)
puzzles.prompt: Answer the multiplication rounds to check the crate story.

ui.introLine: A mole hands you a tiny hard hat: 'Safety first. Then multiplication.'
successQuips: Combo cleared! The crates salute you.
Nice! The banana looks slightly less smug.
failQuips: Nope — the hard hat is disappointed.

hints: Think of groups: 3 groups of 4 means 3 × 4.
Try doubles (×2), then build bigger facts.
Check your work by repeated addition.

rounds.question: 3 crates with 4 bananas each = ?
rounds.solvedQuip: Twelve bananas. That’s a lot of mail.

puzzles.title: Sandwich Sharing Shuffle (÷)
puzzles.prompt: Answer the division rounds. If the sharing story is wrong, someone is fibbing.

ui.introLine: A sandwich appears. It looks nervous.
failQuips: That’s not even sharing. Try again.
The sandwich cries one tiny tear.

hints: Division asks: how many in each group?
Check with multiplication. If 24 ÷ 6 = 4, then 6 × 4 should equal 24.

rounds.question: 18 stamps split into 3 piles = ? per pile

puzzles.title: Exact Change Showdown
puzzles.prompt: Make exactly 65¢ using coins from the drawer.

ui.introLine: The Countess whispers: 'Coins must be arranged by vibe.'
successQuips: Exact change! The coins jingle happily.
failQuips: Not exact. The coins roll away in shame.
The banana says nothing. That’s worse.

hints: Start with a quarter (25¢) and build up.
Two quarters is 50¢. Then you need 15¢ more.
Try using a dime (10¢) and a nickel (5¢).

puzzles.title: Clock Tower Confusion
puzzles.prompt: Read each clock correctly. One suspect got times mixed up…

ui.introLine: The clock tower creaks: 'Please… interpret me correctly.'
successQuips: Time read! The gears sigh in relief.
Correct! The clock stops judging you.
Nice. The banana is late now.
failQuips: Nope. The minute hand is screaming.
Try again—watch where the hour hand points.

hints: Minute hand: count by 5s around the clock.
Hour hand moves between numbers as minutes pass.

finalQuestion.question: Who is lying about their time-based alibi?
correctRationale: The clock clue shows 9:05, which is not the same as 9:50.
The coin clue supports the Countess’s exact-change claim.
The crate multiplication matches the banana invoice evidence.

correct.headline: CASE CLOSED: The Clockwork Squirrel Was… Off By A Lot.
bodyParagraphs: Clockwork Squirrel gasps. 'Time is… not circular?'
With the clocks corrected, the banana is safely escorted out of Mailbox #7.
Everyone agrees to mail only legal objects from now on. Probably.

incorrect.headline: NOT QUITE: The Banana Raises An Eyebrow.
bodyParagraphs: Someone’s alibi is wrong, and it involves reading clocks.

badges.name: Time Tamer
badges.description: Read every clock without getting dizzy.
